citing_paper_authors: Hai Leong, Chieu | Hwee Tou, Ng
raw_text: The importance of dictionaries in NERs has been investigated in the literature (Mikheev et al, 1999)
clean_text: The importance of dictionaries in NERs has been investigated in the literature (Mikheev et al, 1999).

citing_paper_authors: Jenny Rose, Finkel | Shipra, Dingare | Huy, Nguyen | Malvina, Nissim | Christopher D., Manning | Gail, Sinclair
raw_text: 2.2.4 Abstracts A number of NER systems have made effective use of how the same token was tagged in different parts of the same document (see (Curran and Clark, 2003) and (Mikheev et al, 1999))
It has been shown in (Mikheev et al,1999) that a NE Recognition system performs reasonably well for most classes even without gazetteers
clean_text: It has been shown in (Mikheev et al, 1999) that a NE Recognition system performs reasonably well for most classes even without gazetteers.

raw_text: It is common practice in NER to utilize the discourse level to disambiguate items in non predictive contexts (see e.g. Mikheev et al, 1999)
clean_text: It is common practice in NER to utilize the discourse level to disambiguate items in non predictive contexts (see e.g. Mikheev et al, 1999).

raw_text: Mikheev et al (1999) exploit label consistency information within a document using relatively ad hoc multi-stage labeling procedures
clean_text: Mikheev et al (1999) exploit label consistency information within a document using relatively ad hoc multi-stage labeling procedures.

citing_paper_authors: Jochen L., Leidner | Gail, Sinclair | Bonnie Lynn, Webber
raw_text: To date, Named Entity Recognition (NER) has only used gazetteers as evidence that a text span could be some kind of place name (LOCATION), even though their finite nature makes lists of names of limited use for classification (Mikheev et al, 1999)
clean_text: To date, Named Entity Recognition (NER) has only used gazetteers as evidence that a text span could be some kind of place name (LOCATION), even though their finite nature makes lists of names of limited use for classification (Mikheev et al, 1999).

raw_text: Other work has supported the use of gazetteers in general but has found that lists of only moderate size are sufficient to provide most of the benefit (Mikheev et al, 1999)
clean_text: Other work has supported the use of gazetteers in general but has found that lists of only moderate size are sufficient to provide most of the benefit (Mikheev et al, 1999).

citing_paper_authors: Kazi Saidul, Hasan | Altaf, Rahman | Vincent, Ng
raw_text: To investigate the role of gazetteers in NER, Mikheev et al (1999) combine grammar rules with maximum entropy models and vary the gazetteer size
clean_text: To investigate the role of gazetteers in NER, Mikheev et al (1999) combine grammar rules with maximum entropy models and vary the gazetteer size.

raw_text: The internal and external evidence is being used by all NERC systems such as LTG (Mikheev et al 1999), FASTUS (Hobbs et al 1997), Proteus (Yangarber, Grishman, 1998)
clean_text: The internal and external evidence is being used by all NERC systems such as LTG (Mikheev et al 1999), FASTUS (Hobbs et al 1997), Proteus (Yangarber, Grishman, 1998).

raw_text: In such cases all tokens forming an NE and all their combinations are stored in the dynamic lexicon (Mikheev et al 1999:5)
clean_text: In such cases all tokens forming an NE and all their combinations are stored in the dynamic lexicon (Mikheev et al 1999:5).

citing_paper_authors: Joel, Nothman | Tara, Murphy | James R., Curran
raw_text: Since many tagging systems utilise gazetteers of known entities, some research has focused on their automatic extraction from the web (Etzioni et al, 2005) or Wikipedia (Toral et al, 2008), although Mikheev et al (1999) and others have shown that larger NE lists do not necessarily correspond to increased NER performance
clean_text: Since many tagging systems utilise gazetteers of known entities, some research has focused on their automatic extraction from the web (Etzioni et al, 2005) or Wikipedia (Toral et al, 2008), although Mikheev et al (1999) and others have shown that larger NE lists do not necessarily correspond to increased NER performance.

citing_paper_authors: Jenny Rose, Finkel | Trond, Grenager | Christopher D., Manning
raw_text: Several authors have successfully incorporated alabel consistency constraint into probabilistic sequence model named entity recognition systems. Mikheev et al (1999) and Finkel et al (2004) incorporate label consistency information by using ad hoc multi-stage labeling procedures that are effective but special-purpose
clean_text: Mikheev et al (1999) and Finkel et al (2004) incorporate label consistency information by using ad hoc multi-stage labeling procedures that are effective but special-purpose.
